About Bibit Investment Pocket, Bibit Investment Pocket is the information on the value of your portfolio obtained from Bibit displayed on the Jago app. This Pocket will appear under the Pockets tab once you have linked your Jago account with Bibit. 

Tip: Jago is not responsible for the portfolio data displayed in Jago, which is a product of Bibit.

How to my view Bibit's mutual fund investments in Jago?
1. Go to the Pockets menu.

2. Choose one of your Bibit Pocket.

3. You will go to your mutual fund details page in the Bibit app.

Can I make a transactions in the Bibit Pocket?

No, all mutual fund transactions, including buying and selling, can only be done on the Bibit app. Jago will only display portfolio information obtained from Bibit.

Why is there a difference between the Jago app and Bibit information regarding my mutual fund investment value?

The information displayed in the Jago app is obtained from the Bibit party; when you first link the Bibit account to Jago does not appear in real-time, so there will be differences in information. It will be updated if the link is canceled and re-linked.

How to link Jago RDN to Stockbit?

1. Open Stockbit app
2. Choose Jago as the RDN Bank
3. Input your PIN and Jago Bank OTP code to link your account
4. Complete your data, digital signature, and PIN activation for the RDN
5. Wait 1 working day for the verification from Stockbit.

shared pocket role definition

Owner, Can Spend and Can View
What is an Owner

In Shared Pocket, a Pocket Owner is the legal owner of the Pocket. The Owner have full access to everything inside the Pocket, just like on a Personal Pocket.

However, Pocket Owner also given an extra responsibility to manage every members who joined the Pocket. This includes inviting or removing other users, setting users role, managing transaction limit for collaborators who Can Spend, and setting up a target.

Can Spend or Can View

The members who joined the Shared Pocket can be assigned into two roles: Can Spend and Can View.

A member who Can Spend is invited by Pocket Owner and given the access to do transactions inside the Pocket. They can connect a Debit Card to the Pocket if it is a Spending Pocket. They can contribute to a shared target and can do autosave inside the Shared Pocket.

A member who Can View is invited by Pocket Owner with limited access, which can only observe transactions done by the Owner and those who Can Spend. They can contribute to a shared target and can do autosave inside the Shared Pocket.

Owning a Shared Pocket

Every personal Pocket can be turned into a Shared Pocket, simply by inviting other users into it.

1. On your Pockets tab, choose the Pocket to change into a Shared Pocket.
2. Find and tap the Invite button on the top of the screen.
3. Choose members to invite from your Jago Contact or your Phonebook.
4. Once accepted, your Pocket will automatically change into a Shared Pocket.
 

Inviting Other Users to Your Shared Pocket

To invite other users as a collaborator inside your Pocket, follow these steps.

1. On the Pocket page, choose the Pocket you want to share with others.
2. On your Shared Pocket Details page, tap the Invite button on the top of the screen.
3. Choose members to invite from your Jago Contacts or your Phonebook.
4. Select a role for the invitee.
5. Tap Send Invitation and you are done.

Tips:

Make sure the phone number you invite has been registered to Jago
You can invite up to 29 members to the Shared Pocket
 
Joining Other User's Shared Pocket

You can only join a Shared Pocket with an invitation by the Pocket Owner.

1. You will receive a push notification when a Pocket Owner invites you to their Pocket.
2. Inside the application, the invitation can be found inside the notification button on the dashboard.
3. Before accepting the invitation, you are prompted to read the terms and conditions for Shared Pocket.
4. Congratulations! Now you are collaborating inside a Shared Pocket.

shared pocket target 

Setting Up a Joint Target

A joint target is only available if the Pocket is a Savings Pocket. To set up a joint target, simply follow these steps.

1. On the Shared Pocket Details page, tap the Set Joint Target button.
2. Set the target you wish to achieve, and add a deadline if you want.
3. Tap Next.
4. Choose how you want to split the portion between collaborators; equally, or manually assign a portion.
5. Tap Next.
6. Review your target details, and tap the Set Target button to create a joint target.

Tip: Only Pocket Owner can create a joint target.

Managing a Joint Target

Editing a joint target can be done from your Shared Pocket Details page.

1. On the Shared Pocket Details page, tap the 3 dots button on the upper right corner of your screen.
2. Tap Edit joint target button.
3. You can choose to edit the target & deadline or the portion for the target.
4. Follow the steps similar to when you create a new target.

Tip: Only Pocket Owner can manage a joint target.

Deleting a Joint Target

Deleting a joint target can be done from your Shared Pocket Details page.

1. On the Shared Pocket Details page, tap the 3 dots button on the upper right corner of your screen.
2. Tap Edit Pocket details button.
3. Tap the Give up target.
4. Choose Give Up to stop the joint target.

Tip: Only Pocket Owner can stop a joint target.

To close a Shared Pocket, you have to remove all members manually from your Pocket. After that, you can follow this step.

1. On the Shared Pocket Details page, find the 3 dots button on the upper right corner of the screen.
2. Tap Close this Pocket button.
3. Tap Close Now to permanently close the Shared Pocket.

Tip: Once closed, you can no longer access the transaction history of the closed Pocket.

As of December 8, 2021, Pockets can only be closed any day between 01:01 - 23:59 (Western Indonesian Time)

Collaborator Portion on shared target
In making a joint target, you can set a portion for each member. As in the current version of Jago, only an equal split is available. This portion will be the target that needs to be achieved by every single collaborator invited to a Shared Pocket.

For every new, leaving, or removed member, the portion will be automatically updated to match the calculation.

The calculation is as follows:
Individual portions = (total joint target - current balance) / number of members

Any remaining of the calculation will be charged to the Shared Pocket's Owner.

About Shared Pocket Collaborators
A collaborator inside a Shared Pockets includes the Owner and all the invited users. Every collaborator can contribute to a joint target and can do autosave inside the Shared Pocket.

What is an Owner
In Shared Pocket, a Pocket Owner is the legal owner of the Pocket. The Owner has full access to everything inside the Pocket, just like on a Personal Pocket.

However, Pocket Owner has an extra responsibility to manage every collaborator who joined the Pocket. This includes inviting or removing other users, setting the user's role, managing transaction limit for collaborators who Can Spend, and setting up a target.

Can Spend or Can View
The Owner can assign one of these two roles to the members: Can Spend or Can View.

A member who Can Spend can do transactions inside the Pocket.

A member who Can View is given limited access, only to observe transactions done by the Owner and those who Can Spend.

Setting Up Can Spend Limit
Shared Pocket Owner can set Can Spend role for its members. For invited members, the maximum limit per day that can be used is Rp 10,000,000.

The maximum limit referred to is the accumulation of transactions in a day. For example, if the maximum daily limit specified is Rp 1,000,000, then members are free to make transactions any number of times a day as long as the total transaction value does not exceed Rp 1,000,000.

This limit includes outside transactions, and also moving money from the Shared Pocket to the member's own Pocket.

To change the limit of a member, follow these steps:

1. In your Shared Pocket Details page, tap the icon with your member's profile picture.
2. Tap one of the Can Spend members you wish to change.
3. Tap Transaction limit.
4. Set up the daily transaction limit for this member.
5. Tap Change Limit to save.

Leaving a Shared Pocket
When a member leaves or removed from a Shared Pocket, his/her contribution will be moved under the Others category. It is up to the Owner to give a refund to the leaving member or not.

When a Pocket has a target, the target will be recalculated to the rest of the members.

Risks of Shared Pockets
1. The changes in the interest rate follow the market trend.
2. Savings will not being covered by LPS if:
2.1 The accumulated savings amount (including interest) at one bank exceeds Rp 2 billion; and/or
2.2 The applicable interest rate exceeds the LPS-guaranteed interest rate (click here for further information).
3. A savings account will potentially be considered dormant in the absence of any transactions for 18 consecutive months.
4. The risk of improper use of the collective funds in the Shared Pocket by the Pocket Owner because the Pocket Owner is the legal owner entitled to all the collected funds in the Shared Pocket.

About Pocket
A Pocket (Kantong in Indonesian) is where you put your money in Jago. It allows you to separate your money into multiple Pockets based on your needs. Personalised it by giving your pockets any name youâ€™d like, upload a photo or use emojis, and use your favorite color as the background.

You can set up your Pocket for different puRp oses. To ease your daily transactions, choose Spending Pocket where you can attach a Visa debit card to it and use it for e-commerce shopping or withdraw in any ATMs around the globe. To motivate you on your life goals, choose Savings Pocket and you can set up a target to see your saving progress and visualised how close you are to your goal; on top of that you can also activate autosave function that will top-up the savings for you.

But why stop there? Invite your family, significant others, and your friends to collaborate and save together with you! Tip: You are limited to 20 Savings Pockets and 20 Spending Pockets, you can add, remove, and change its puRp ose anytime you want.

Adding New Pockets

Adding a new Pocket can be done directly from your Pockets landing screen.

1. In your Pockets tab, tap the Add Pocket button.
2. Choose the Pocket template to suit your financial needs.
3. Give your Pocket a name, and set the background color and picture.
4. Choose between creating a Pocket for saving or spending.
5. Tap the Create Pocket button and you're done!"

Personalizing Pockets

Editing an existing Pocket can be done through your Pocket Details page.
1. On your Pockets tab, choose the Pocket you wish to edit.
2. Find and tap the 3 dots button on the upper-right corner of your screen
3. Select Personalize Pocket.
4. Make changes to your Pocket details.
5. Tap Save to finish editing.
 
Closing Pockets

By closing your Pocket before the 28th, you acknowledge that you are forfeiting the deleted pocket interest.
1. On your Pockets tab, choose the Pocket you wish to delete.
2. Find and tap the 3 dots button on the upper-right corner of your screen
3. Select Close Pocket
4. Tap Close Now to confirm your action

Tip: Closing the Pocket will delete all transaction history happening inside those Pocket.

Tip: Closing your Pocket requires you to stop any active target happening inside the Pocket.

As of December 8, 2021, Pockets can only be closed any day between 01:01 - 23:59 (Western Indonesian Time)

How Do I Add Money To a Pocket

You can add money to your Pocket from another Pocket or your Main Account directly from your Pocket Details page.

1. On your Pockets tab, choose the Pocket you wish to add money in
2. Tap on the Add Money button
3. Type in how much money you want to add and select the Pocket source
4. Tap Add Money to finalize

Spend Money From Pockets

You can spend your money or transfer it to another bank account directly from your Pocket Details page. Please note, you can only spend money if your Pocket is a Spending Pocket.

1. On your Pockets tab, choose the Pocket you wish to spend from
2. Tap the Transfer & Pay button
3. Choose the intended destination
4. Input the amount of money to pay/send
5. After confirming your number, tap Send Now.
